SpaceApps Junior Challenge 2025

Space Innovation for Young Explorers

Published

October 3, 2025

  1. Home
  2. Academy
  3. Programs
  4. Hackathons
  5. SpaceApps Junior Challenge
October 3-5, 2025
Add to Calendar Download PDF
Craiova Art Museum, Craiova

Event Overview

The SpaceApps Junior Challenge 2025 is a special edition of the NASA Space Apps Challenge designed specifically for participants aged 13-18. This three-day event gives young space enthusiasts the opportunity to solve real-world space challenges using NASA’s open data in a supportive, educational environment. The event is designed to inspire the next generation of scientists, engineers, and innovators while making space exploration accessible to youth.

Challenge Themes

The junior hackathon features simplified challenges across several themes tailored for young participants:

1. Earth & Space Science

Explore climate data, natural disasters, or observe stars and planets using NASA’s resources. Create projects that help us understand our planet and universe better.

2. Space Technology

Create applications, games, or visualizations that help explain complex space concepts to other students. Design interactive tools that make space more accessible.

3. Space Exploration

Design ideas for future missions, spacecraft, or habitats for astronauts. Think about how humans might live and work in space in the future.

4. Creative Arts & Space

Develop creative projects that combine art, storytelling, and space science to communicate space concepts to the public. Make space exciting for everyone!

Schedule

Day 1 (October 3)

Time Activity
09:00 - 10:00 Registration and Welcome
10:00 - 11:00 Opening Ceremony and Introduction to NASA Data
11:00 - 12:00 Challenge Presentations & Examples
12:00 - 13:00 Team Formation and Idea Workshop
13:00 - 14:00 Lunch
14:00 - 16:00 Crash Course: “Working with Space Data”
16:00 - 18:00 Project Planning Session
18:00 - 19:00 Dinner
19:00 - 20:00 Fun Activity: “Space Trivia Challenge”

Day 2 (October 4)

Time Activity
09:00 - 10:00 Breakfast and Daily Briefing
10:00 - 13:00 Project Development with Mentor Support
13:00 - 14:00 Lunch
14:00 - 15:00 Workshop: “Presenting Your Ideas”
15:00 - 18:00 Continued Project Development
18:00 - 19:00 Dinner
19:00 - 20:00 Space Movie Night (Optional)

Day 3 (October 5)

Time Activity
09:00 - 10:00 Breakfast and Final Tips
10:00 - 12:00 Project Finalization
12:00 - 13:00 Lunch
13:00 - 15:00 Project Showcase (3-minute presentations)
15:00 - 16:00 Judging & Feedback
16:00 - 17:00 Awards Ceremony and Certificates
17:00 - 18:00 Celebration and Photos

Prizes and Recognition

  • Grand Prize: Science kits, telescopes, and an opportunity to join a virtual Q&A with NASA scientists
  • Theme Winners: Educational tech gadgets and personalized mentorship from STEM professionals
  • Best Teamwork Award: Space-themed prizes and a special workshop on collaborative innovation
  • Most Creative Solution: Art supplies and feature on the SpaceApps Junior showcase website

All participants will receive certificates, SpaceApps Junior t-shirts, and digital badges for their portfolios.

Who Should Participate

  • Students aged 13-18 interested in space, science, or technology
  • Young people curious about NASA and space exploration
  • Teens with creative skills in art, design, storytelling, or media
  • Students interested in coding, data, or engineering
  • School science clubs and STEM program participants
  • First-time hackathon participants welcome - no experience necessary!

Registration Information

Registration opens on July 17, 2025. Participation is free and open to all students aged 13-18. Space is limited to 80 participants, so early registration is encouraged. Students can register individually or in teams of 3-4 members. Individual participants will be helped to find teams during the first day of the event. Parental consent forms will be required for all participants.

Join the Next Generation of Space Innovators

Be part of a weekend that could launch groundbreaking ideas for space exploration and technology.

Register Interest

Frequently Asked Questions

What skills or background do I need to participate?

Teams benefit from diverse skills - programming, engineering, design, business development, and domain knowledge in space-related fields are all valuable. No specific space expertise is required - mentors will provide guidance and resources.

What should I bring?

Bring your laptop, relevant software tools, and any hardware components you may need for prototyping. Basic electronic components and 3D printing facilities will be available on-site.

Is there a participation fee?

No, participation is free for all students. This includes meals, materials, and access to all resources during the event.

Will data and APIs be provided?

Yes, we will provide access to NASA’s datasets, space-related APIs, and specialized software tools in a simplified format suitable for teenage participants.

Is accommodation included?

Accommodation is not included. Parents/guardians are responsible for transportation to and from the venue each day.

What’s Next

After participating in the SpaceApps Junior Challenge, continue your tech journey with these programs:

  • Computer Club - Ongoing monthly meetups and workshops
  • Junior Summer School - July 7-21, 2025
  • Cybersecurity Basics Workshop - March 15-17, 2025
  • Main SpaceApps Challenge - For students 18+ and adults
